p: Elevated levels of CRP (>5 mg/L) and PCT (>0.5 μg/L) were present in 99% and 94% of patients, respectively, and were detected on median day 5 of disease; i.e., on admission to hospital. In 64/81 (79%) patients the level of CRP was ≥50 mg/L. Elevated creatinine was found in 94% of patients at 1–12 (median 6) days after the onset of illness. The majority of patients were discharged from hospital with some degree of renal failure.
